record.attribute: After running a search or strategy that returns genes, you can analyze the results to find statistically enriched Gene Ontology annotations, Metabolic Pathway annotations or words in the gene product descriptions. Click the blue Analyze Results button to run an enrichment analysis on the gene result highlighted in yellow.

you can run an analysis on a gene result ?
Click on the blue button to select an analysis tool.

1. Direct the Genome Browser to the genomic location that you want to amplify.
2. Choose Design Primers from the drop down menu and click GO.
3. The Primer Design application opens in a new window where you can highlight the region you want to amplify, set your primer parameters and click Design Primers.
you can use the Genome Browser to design PCR primers ?

Use the Select Tracks tab of the Genome Browser to turn on the data tracks that you want to view. The Browser is automatically updated with the tracks you choose. To bookmark the view, choose Generate URL from the File dropdown menu. Then, using your internet browser, bookmark the updated URL. Use this bookmark to return to the GBrowse view or to share the view with colleagues when discussing the data.

you can configure the Genome Browser to display specific data tracks ?
(eg: proteomics or mRNAseq data from selected experiments)
and you may also bookmark your favorite configurations for future use.

Running a search places you in the Search Strategy system. Your search is the first "step" of a new strategy. To refine your result set, add steps to the strategy as needed. Click the Add Step button to add a step. You will be prompted to choose a search. Next you will be prompted to combine the new search with the previous results (using intersect, union or minus). The new results reflect this combination. We hope strategies help you get the most from the data!
you can click Add Step to add a step to your strategy ?
To view the results of a prior search or combination, click on a step box.
you can see results of a previous step by clicking on its box ?

For a menu of actions/properties for a step's search click on the "Edit" icon near the step box. For a menu of actions/properties for how it is combined with the prior step, click on the "Edit" icon near the Venn diagram.
you can get a menu of step actions by clicking on the "Edit" icon ?

Simple strategies are linear. More advanced strategies include branches. (For example one step may need to union two searches.) The trick is to "nest" a strategy within a step. Click the "Edit" icon to get a menu. Choose "Make Nested Strategy." Now that step appears expanded in a panel below. All steps added to that panel will be nested into the step in the panel above. The whole nested strategy acts as a single step in the parent strategy.

you can branch a strategy ?
Choose "Make Nested Strategy" in the step actions menu.
